page.title: 04NTH. KILWORTH'S BUILDINGS
page.content: North Kilworth is a village which has no buildings of especial architectural merit. There are, however one or two examples of different styles which are of interest. There are two examples of timber framed house dating from C17th.Tudor Cottages ,Back Lane ,are thatched,whereas the roof of the house in Cranmer Lane has been covered with corrugated iron. North Kilworth House and Ivy House are of the C18th.Ivy House having the more pleasing,symmetrical front elevation . Netherhall is a good example of a large victorian house,but there are several houses possessing fancy barge boards and other victorian features. All the houses are brick,usually with slate or more lately, tile ,roofs. There are cottages up to 250yrs old.
